Key Match Events: Damian Lillard led all scorers with 34 points on 12-of-22 shooting from the field
Giannis Antetokounmpo logged 31 points on 11-of-21 shooting from the floor
An 18-6 run put the Bucks up 88-77 at the end of the third quarter
Guard AJ Green, reserve power forward/center Bobby Portis and guard Pat Connaughton helped the Bucks build out an 18-point lead early into the fourth frame
Pre-Game Insights: Coach Doc Rivers emphasized the importance of demoting Gary Trent Jr. and promoting Andre Jackson Jr.
The matchup was between two 1-6 clubs, the Utah Jazz and the Milwaukee Bucks
Rivers finally listened to his eyes and demoted Trent, who played just 7:52 in a blowout
Post-Match Reflections: Rivers was subbing out his stars for good and calling it a night by 3:25 in the fourth frame
Portis finished with 19 points on 7-of-15 shooting from the field and 2-of-3 shooting from the foul line
Green was Milwaukee's only other double-digit scorer (12 points)
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Bucks' two All-Stars each scored over 30 points again
The team's offense has been thrown completely out of whack with Middleton indefinitely shelved
Others: The Bucks are back in the winner's circle again, after a six-game losing streak
The team has improved to a still-bad 2-6
More might be revealed on Friday night, when Milwaukee travels to Madison Square Garden to suit up against the 3-4 New York Knicks
